chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:04 AM Defendant Eric Warfield in court.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Eric Warfield.  Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defense states that defendant has retained counsel and he is not available on this date.
Defendant states he has not paid to retain counsel yet but needs 45 days to accomplish this.
BTC: Set over 60 days.
Status conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Racine County Alternatives Program

9:43 AM Defendant Eric Warfield in court.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Eric Warfield.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defense requests additional status to meet with defendant.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Racine County Alternatives Program
Defendant appeared, warrant vacated prior to entry.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
NG plea entered.

11:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric Warfield in court.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Eric Warfield. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant now appears.
BTC: Vacate Warrant, reinstate bond.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:39 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric Warfield not in court.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Eric Warfield. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant has no explanation for the non appearance.
BTC:  No appearance by defendant, Arrest/Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond to be forfeited.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on July 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with L.H

10:41 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric Warfield in court, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Eric Warfield. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense requests a contested prelim. Defense has also filed a bond motion in this matter. Gives further statements on the record
Court reviews bond motion.
State does not have an objection.
BTC: Bond motion granted, bond set to $5000 cash, conditions to remain the same.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defense.
